title: BJP motormouths hurting NDA: Shiromani Akali Dal
text:
NEW DELHI: Irresponsible statements by responsible leaders despite repeated warnings by the BJP leadership is taking the focus away from the good work that has been done by the Prime Minister and the finance minister to resurrect the economy, a senior leader of NDA ally Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) said on Saturday.
"This is damaging the image of the NDA, BJP and PM and I hope that they (those making irresponsible statements) would be disciplined," SAD MP Naresh Gujral told TOI.
He said the NDA's main agenda was to bring a transformative change in the economy and that was being diluted by "irresponsible" statements. He hoped that the BJP leadership will take action to discipline them.
Gujral termed the Dadri killing as a national shame. "It is a national shame and every right thinking Indian will condemn it," he said.
The Rajya Sabha member lamented that the motormouths were not paying heed to even Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Apart from MPs like Sakshi Maharaj, minister of state for culture Mahesh Sharma has generated a spate of headlines by making controversial remarks on a range of issues. The minister toned down after he was cautioned but has since returned to his usual voluble ways. While this has annoyed some of his seniors, there is still no clarity whether the leadership has taken a similar dim view of the remarks of the culture minister who seemed to be making a deliberate effort to ingratiate himself with the hardliners in the party and the larger Sangh parivar. While PM had described the Dadri incident as 'sad and unfortunate', Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's comments brought the spotlight back on the brutal lynching of Mohammed Akhlaq.
